name: The Pelham Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed many times at the Pelham hotel. Room very small but forgivable as the building is an old English style building and everything is so tastefully done. Very elegant and beds very comfortable! Friendly little Orel and really like the two little sitting rooms on ground level. One of them has an open loyalty bar, meaning you serve yourself what you fancy and just write it down in a little book. Very civilised. Also, great location....right in front of south Kensington tube station.
reviews.title: Great little hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were on the small side, but a nice location and great quality of fittings and equipment. Good food and great staff. The concierge is worth his weight in gold! He has an answer to everything, and comes with the answer instantly and he is always available. Remember to give him a good tip, as you would find yourself using him constantly....ill be back!
reviews.title: 1st class service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Pelham has a great location because it is across the street from the South Kensington station. The neighborhood is very safe. It has very comfortable and quiet rooms. The staff are very attentive, polite and friendly. Just a charming small hotel! It is maybe a five minute walk to the Museum of Natural History and the Victoria and Albert Museum. Lots of restaurants nearby with reasonable prices. We had a wonderful time!
reviews.title: Wonderfully quaint hotel in a great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The smell of fresh flowers and prompt, courteous service were a welcome and refreshing treat as my family and I entered the Pelham’s reception area. Our bags were whisked away immediately to our room, which was ready even though it was only morning. After a long trip, we were grateful for the kind staff—and grateful that the metro was only steps away from the hotel. Our room was spacious, tastefully decorated, and it overlooked the streets of London. The bathroom was also quite large and well laid-out. Countertops, floors, mirrors and all surfaces actually shined. Since the hotel is not a cold, huge chain of hundreds of rooms, the gym in the basement (open 24 hours) was just the right size—no competition from anxious tourists trying to compete for equipment. (Even if there had been such competition, Hyde Park is right nearby with plenty of hassle-free opportunities to run in a beautiful setting.) The main floor and landings on the stairs held comfortable chairs and couches for reading and relaxing. The laptop in the meeting room was just perfect for sending a quick hello or pictures to friends and family. Most of all, we were extremely impressed with the concierge. The next part of our trip included further travel by train and another hotel stay in the Lake District. We had questions about how to pick up the bus from the Penrith Train Station. The concierge looked up the bus company online and realized their offices were closed at that hour so instead, he found a McDonald’s near the bus station in Penrith and called them. He really went out of his way to give us good information and to make us feel welcome. We did not eat in the restaurant, but breakfast certainly smelled tempting as I worked out in the gym, which was next to the kitchen. Fresh apples and cold water are always available and refreshing. Additionally, many good restaurants are within a short walking distance. Overall, I can say that I rested quite well. Other patrons of the hotel seemed respectful of one another and yes, I could hear the metro at night, but in a weary traveler’s haze, it sounded like low rumbles of thunder lulling me to sleep.
reviews.title: Refreshing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed: May 7th-May10th
reviews.title: Small but well presented

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: Probably the most genuinely friendly hotel in London and not just because they feel it is their job. The rooms are easily of a five star standard but as a regular traveller it is the staff that make a hotel not the surroundings so top marks to them. One of the sales ladies called Alison I got chatting to not only suggest the uber cool places to go but even managed to call a friend and get me on the guest list which lonely planet said had a strict face policy. Thanks Alison and all the staff for making my visit so memorable.
reviews.title: Very friendly hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed three nights at The Pelham in early June before moving on to the coast for a cruise and despite an issue or two we would consider this hotel on a return to London. The location in South Kensington is great - lots of cafes, bakeries and restaurants very close by - and as others have mentioned the tube station is right across the street. It is a busy area but we did not find it to be overly noisy or crowded so no concerns there. The staff was great, especially Jamie (sp?) the concierge who gave us several on-the-money suggestions for restaurants and was able to get us reservations for a couple of very popular places at just the times we wanted. He was very professional and a great asset to the hotel.
reviews.title: Good Experience Overall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We were less enthusiastic about our room. It was a bit smaller than I had expected since we had upgraded to a King room. The room configurations must vary because our traveling companions had the same class of room and the layout of theirs seem to offer more space. Our bigger issue, however, was that our room was very, very warm most of the time and we found it difficult to get to sleep one or two nights. The room temperature/climate controls did not seem to have any effect. We mentioned our problem to the front desk as we went out one day and returned to find that the apparent solution was to fully open a window that had no screen, something we did not want to do at night.
reviews.title: Best Hotel Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Despite the room disappointments, the hotel has many charms and that, along with the concierge and the location, made it a good experience for us.
reviews.title: Still very good but lost its edge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A friend recommended The Pelham to us, and although it was a bit pricey, we decided to give it a try. I'm so glad we did; the hotel far exceeded expectations. The staff were genuinely helpful, the room was luxurious and extremely quiet and the food was fantastic. And the Pelham is very conveniently located just across from a Tube station, which made it extremely easy to come back & forth through-out the day. We will definitely stay at The Pelham next time we visit London.
reviews.title: Elegance in the heart of London

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed two nights in a large 2nd floor room on the street side. The location is great, the room was superb (new décor, great amenities, comfy bed) and the staff v helpful. The only drawback was some minor street traffic noise and some noise from the room above - at 5.25am both mornings it felt like someone was lifting weights or doing some jumping! I guess with a character filled older style hotel there are going to be some drawbacks but overall we loved our stay at the Pelham and would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Comfortable and well located

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: Very nice hotel with windows that open. A rarity these days. Unfortunately the single lift broke and the stairs were the only option. The rooms are comfortable and nicely sized and the staff is very friendly and helpful. Getting on the tube was quick and painless. I was on the third floor in the back and it was very quiet.
reviews.title: Charming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose this hotel because of all the positive reviews, but did not find that the Pelham lives up to its reputation. The first room that we were given was on the ground floor and the subway literally ran underneath it every 2 minutes. In addition to this there was no natural light in this room (3).
reviews.title: Noisy but good breakfast options

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we complained about the noise and the rattling, the front desk said rooms 3 and 4 are actually some of the least noisy rooms. Needless to say, we asked them if they had stayed in the room themselves in order to give such a faulty review. After (way too much back and forth), the front desk offered us an upgrade towards payment. We asked to speak to the manager, and they gave us a Queen Superior room on the 4th floor at the same price. Room 410 had natural light, a "view" to a factory/work place, decent bad and decent bathroom (although the sink didn't drain).
reviews.title: Very nice but not amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: Overall, be very careful not to book any rooms in the ground floor, and do not expect accomodations worthy of the nightly rate in this hotel. You can find a better hotel.
reviews.title: Loved my 18-night stay...location, service, comfort!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Just returned from our 4th trip to London. Usually stay at The Sofitel St. James, but this time wanted a smaller, neighborhood hotel. The Pelham was a great choice. The location is perfect...easy walk to tons of great restaurants (try Cacciari's just around the corner..best Italian meal we had in London followed by gelato from Scoop), Starbucks and Pret also around the corner, along with ATM, dry cleaners and best of all underground stop where 3 lines cross. We used the underground for all our travel (buy an Oyster Card) and it was so great not having to get switch lines. The hotel lobby and library is lovely and the staff extremely kind and welcoming. You won't receive a plastic key card here...instead you are given a key on a leather fob which you hand over to them when you head out each day. A stellar staff...dinner suggestions were wonderful along with travel details. We were in room 408...top floor, very quiet, comfy king bed and really hot water! Yes, the bathroom is small, but it is completely updated and everything is very clean. Our son was in a different room and the AC malfunctioned...no worries, they immediately moved him to another room. We only ate breakfast once in the restaurant and it was really good. I loved staying here...only one downside...charging for WiFi is not a good idea at all. It's free in the lobby and library, but they have to provide the password. You pay for it in your room. That's the only reason I did not give this review 5 stars.
reviews.title: American Family/London Boutique Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: Well the website was correct when it said the tube station was opposite the entrance to the hotel. Just the busy road to navigate but if you use the crossing at the traffic lights people, it is not difficult!
reviews.title: Delightful little gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The initial welcome was lovely, the service outstanding and understated. Nothing gaudy or in your face. No hotel chain script or sales pitch here. The initial reaction was that the room was small but in reality it was a large and comfortable oversize bed. The bathroom was excellent and the a/c worked! It had to work as I could not open the window but at least this way any noise from the road was eliminated. The hotel is ideally located for the museums and the Albert Hall with good access to the whole of London's West End dand with staff providing a top notch service this is an hotel I would hope to use again and would happily recommend!
reviews.title: Jolly Good Time at the Pelham

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: We are a family of three and had a wonderful stay at this hotel. A great, great location to walk to Hyde park, the metro and lovely restaurants. The breakfast buffet and menu was delicious and reasonably priced. The staff was helpful, especially the concierge which we used quite a bit. When we go back to London, our family would stay there again because of its wonderful location, amenities and thoughtful staff.
reviews.title: Great location, not so great experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We do not like to eat big meals everyday and we especially appreciated the wonderful deli across the street, healthy take-out places and the chance to dine at more upscale places in the neighborhood if we wanted. The concierge helped us find everything we wanted food-wise.
reviews.title: A very special place to stay

description: The Pelham is a unique, stylish boutique hotel in the very heart of South Kensington. Each and every room has been individually designed by Kit Kemp, blending the enchantment of English style with modern colours and flair, The Pelham has been described as one of London's finest townhouse hotels. Our guests have the privilege of exclusive use of the wood paneled drawing room and library both with open fireplaces, business centre as well as our 24-hour fitness room. Kensington is awash with boutiques, bars and bistros not to mention our own Bistro Fifteen with our mouth-watering and sumptuous menu, inspired by fresh quality ingredients and flavours of the Mediterranean Cuisine. In our BAR 15 discover our selection of organic wines together with our home made terrines. Our stylish Event Suites can be transformed from a corporate meeting area into a glamorous space for private dining, drinks receptions, baby showers and afternoon teas. Minutes from the Victoria & Albert and Natural History Museums, Harrods, Hyde Park and The Royal Albert Hall, The Pelham really is the perfect foundation for your sophisticated stay in London.
